DOC.brief_title: Oral Tramadol Versus Diclofenac For Pain Relief Before Outpatient Hysteroscopy :
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective double-blind , randomize , clinical trial , conduct Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital- Early Cancer Detection Unite [ ECDU ] . Patients fulfil inclusion exclusion criterion divide three group . Group A ( study group ) Include 34 patient receive Tramadol 100mg orally 1 hour procedure . Group B ( study group ) Include 34 patient receive Diclofenac 100mg orally 1 hour procedure . Group C ( control group ) Include 34 patient receive placebo . Pain evaluate two separate occasion : immediately procedure 15 minute procedure use 100mm line visual analog scale .
DOC.criteria: BMI raging ( 18.5 30 ) . Scheduled diagnostic hysteroscopy . All give informed write consent . Any contraindication hysteroscopy ( e.g . suspected pregnancy , genital tract infection ) . Receiving form analgesia . Patients known cervical stenosis , polyps ulcer . Previous cervical surgery . Patients plan invasive intrauterine therapeutic intervention hysteroscopy . know sensitivity nonsteroidal antiinflammatory opioids drug . Known gastritis peptic ulcer cardiac disease Respiratory dysfunction . Unwilling comply protocol , Participation another clinical trial last three month prior start study
